pr_title: [BESU-1059] Fix "Pausing mining" log even though node is not a validator

timeline.message:
remove log on clique network if no validator

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'upstream/master' into feature/besu-1059-invalid-mining-log

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Nit: could we not use "mining"?  I always associate that with PoW mining and nonce solving.  Is there a more different term like "sealing" "block production" or "validating" we could use?
timeline.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: Done. I used block production for the log. For now, I keep the class called CliqueMiningCoordinator because it inherits from AbstractMiningCoordinator and implements MiningCoordinator. If we want to change that. this should be done in another PR. Because the impacts can be significant IMO
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: Mining is the correct term here for sure.
timeline.author: shemnon

timeline.bodyText: do we want to be careful here? The coinbase is not necessarily this node's ID (maybe in our code base, but the concepts are different) - it'd be nice to see this comparing nodeKey against validator list
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Done. I created an isSigner method in CliqueHelpers because there was already a very close implementation and it used the node's ID
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe isSigner? IBFT2 has validators, Clique has signers.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: I created an isSigner method in CliqueHelpers
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: this shouldn't be exposed here - this class isn't a carriage for this - its used internally to determine if/how we can mine.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: This part has been moved to the mining tracker class. This is no longer exposed
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: rather than exposing the ProtocolContext, we can add a function "isValidator" to the CliqueMiningTracker?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: using getCoinbase() is kinda dangerous as it does not necessarily relate to the local node's ID.
replies.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Changed. I am now using the node's ID; Good catch
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: nit: the haltMiningOperation will stop the current mining operation, which is sort of a side-effect - in the past I've avoided side-effects in conditions - not sure we care.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: This is no longer present in the CliqueMiningCoordinator class. The original implementation has been moved back to the abstract class. But indeed this behavior was already there
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: nit: changing this from private to protected opens the API significantly (and just for logging purposes) - is there a way we can move the conditional into the child-class, but keep the heavy-lifting here?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: The new implementation no longer needs this
replies.author: matkt

replies.bodyText: I created two methods onPauseMining and onResumeMining which allow to keep the main implementation in the abstract class
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: nit: could/should this stay in the base class? and just overriden in clique?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: I have just changed; I reduced to minimum what must be overriden
replies.author: matkt

timeline.message:
Merge branch 'upstream/master' into feature/besu-1059-invalid-mining-log

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

fix review issues

Signed-off-by: Karim TAAM <karim.t2am@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: nit: Other thing I was thinking - is this really an "info" level log - or can it be reduced to debug? Seems like something we wouldn't need to see all the time.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: IMO it can be interesting to see that the block production start and stop without changing the log level to debug. Do you really think that we need to change it ?
replies.author: matkt

replies.bodyText:
No - just wanted to ask.
I feel the logging Besu is a generally bit verbose/noisy - so I tend to be pretty hard with what should be at info/debug/trace.
Really dropping out of sync is the problem - the fact that mining is paused is kinda an obvious side effect - so maybe "Lost Sync" is in info, and stopping mining is debug.
But seriously, happy to let it lie and push this in.
replies.author: rain-on
